bullets.text: U.S. clears Nvidia H200 AI chip sales to China, reportedly seeking 25% revenue cut; Nvidia shares jump on expanded TAM.
White House unveils $12B bailout for farmers hurt by tariffs, cushioning trade-war fallout on agriculture.
Paramount-Skydance launches $108B hostile bid for Warner Bros. Discovery, intensifying media consolidation battle with Netflix; regulatory and political scrutiny loom.
IBM to acquire Confluent for $11B, bolstering real-time data and AI infrastructure portfolio.
NextEra to build 15 GW of power for data centers by 2035; teams with Exxon on gigawatt campus for a hyperscaler.
Asia-Pacific stocks drop, tracking Wall Street, as investors await Fed rate decision.
U.S. home sellers are delisting at unusually high rates, signaling weak buyer demand and pricing resets.
Japan assembles China-light rare-earth supply chain via Lynas and diversification, strengthening materials security for EVs and magnets.
Waymo surpasses 450,000 weekly paid robotaxi rides, widening commercialization lead over rivals.
Environmental groups seek moratorium on new data centers over power and water strains, raising permitting and cost risks for AI infrastructure.
Two major trials find GLP-1 drugs fail to slow Alzheimer's, tempering hopes for crossover neuroprotection.
Supreme Court appears set to expand presidential power to fire independent officials, potentially reshaping regulatory oversight and market rules.
